intro: Malache panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian malache, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Panama. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
